description:
On January 26th 2020, Sri Lanka announced that all passengers from flights originated from China need to be screened for temperature. If a passenger with elevated temperature is detected, he/she should be given a surgical mask to wear and taken to the health office.
   
   All suspected 2019-nCoV patients need to be screened by airport health office (APHO) medical officers. Consent for examination and further assessment should be obtained from the traveler or parent of guardian. If consent is not given, the traveler/s will be managed under the authority given by the Quarantine and Prevention of Diseases Ordinance.
   
   If the traveler has a contact history and fever/signs and symptoms, the traveler should be transferred to IDH/ designated hospitals.Director or a designed officer from these hospitals should immediately contact the Chief Epidemiologist and the D Quarantine and should immediately provide relevant patient information for required surveillance, prevention and further actions.
   
   Passengers Locator Form should be filled for those travelers with suspected nCoV seated in the same row and two rows in front and behind the index suspected case. The details should be communicated to the Epidemiology Unit, which will carry out the community level contact tracing and house quarantine of asymptomatic contacts with the help of Regional Epidemiologist and MOOH.

description:
Sri Lanka established on March 25th a special mechanism to deliver essential food items to homes. Medicine will be delivered to the homes of regular patients who have registered at hospitals with the support of Divisional Secretaries, Public Health Officers and the security forces. Authorities was requested to implement a programme to supply domestic gas at consumer’s doorstep responding to the telephone orders.

The objective of the entire project is to prevent the public from gathering at market places so that the health sector’s efforts to combat the coronavirus could be a success.

description:
Announced on 7 April 2020, Sri Lanka is introducing a mechanism to streamline the issuing of curfew permits to avoid people gathering in large numbers to get curfew permits.

Curfew permits for Industries/Institutions/Companies with 50 or more employees located in Colombo District of Western province will be issued by the Police Headquarters.

Curfew permits for Industries/Institutions/Companies with 50 or more employees  will be issued by the Office of the Deputy Inspector General of Police in Charge of the Province that they are located.

Curfew permits for Industries/Institutions/Companies with 10-50 employees located in each Police Division will be issued by the respective Offices of the Superintendents of Police in Charge of the Divisions.

Curfew permits for industries/institutions/companies with less than 10 employees and individuals on extreme humanitarian reasons are issued by police stations.
